answerText: Manfred Schlosser[10] Schlosser names a modification of this other chemical reaction, in which a phosphonium ylide is used to synthesize an alkene from a carbonyl compound.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Editors 2 | 11 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This man names a superbase that is a combination of n‐butyllithium and potassium t‐butoxide. For 10 points: [10] Name this German chemist, who also names a procedure which uses phenyllithium to switch the configuration of a betaine intermediate in order to create E‐alkenes.
